note.p: Psychical researcher and essayist. BA, Cambridge (Trinity College), 1864; fellow, Trinity College, 1865–74; college lecturer in classics, 1865–9. Founding member of the Society for Psychical Research, 1882. Author of Phantasms of the living (with Edmund Gurney and Frank Podmore, 1886), Science and a future life (1893), and Human personality and its survival of bodily death (1903).
